com.fluxchess.pulse

Class Pulse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fluxchess.jcpi.AbstractEngine
      • com.fluxchess.pulse.Pulse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.fluxchess.jcpi.commands.IEngine, Runnable

    public final class Pulse
extends com.fluxchess.jcpi.AbstractEngine
    Pulse uses the Java Chess Protocol Interface (JCPI) to handle the UCI protocol. We simply extend AbstractEngine and implement the required methods.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pulse()
      This is our default constructor to create Pulse.
      Pulse(BufferedReader input, PrintStream output)
      We could also provide our own input and output streams.
      Pulse(com.fluxchess.jcpi.protocols.IProtocolHandler handler)
      We could also provide our own IProtocolHandler.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pulse

        public Pulse()
        This is our default constructor to create Pulse. It will use the standard input and output.

      • Pulse

        public Pulse(BufferedReader input,
     PrintStream output)
        We could also provide our own input and output streams. We could e.g. connect a network stream to our engine.
        Parameters:
        input - a buffered reader.
        output - a print stream.

      • Pulse

        public Pulse(com.fluxchess.jcpi.protocols.IProtocolHandler handler)
        We could also provide our own IProtocolHandler. We will use this constructor in our unit tests.
        Parameters:
        handler - a protocol handler.
